title: SHOW REFERENCES | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
Lists the references defined for an application in the manifest file and the references the
consumer has associated to the application.
Specifies the name of the application.
This command displays the following information about the references defined for the application:
The label of the reference as specified in the manifest file.
A description of the reference and what it does.

The privileges that the reference requires. Refer to
Object types and privileges that a reference can contain for the list of privileges that a
reference can required for an object.

The type of object associated with the reference. Refer to
Object types and privileges that a reference can contain for a list of the supported
objects for a reference.
Indicates if the reference requires more than one type of object.

The name of the object specified by the reference after the consumer associates the object
with the application.

The name of the schema of the object associated with this reference or NULL if no object
has been associated or if the associated object is an account object.

The name of database of the object associated with this reference or NULL if one of
the following is true:
No object is specified in the reference definition.
The object is not a database or database object.

A name that uniquely identifies a reference to an object, including the object name,
scope and privileges
